paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses a case of peripheral neuropathy due to amyloidosis linked to a TTR variant from a liver transplant donor.

patients.phenotype: Peripheral neuropathy due to ATTR amyloidosis

individual_records.phenotype_details: Developed neuropathic symptoms including numbness and paraesthesia in feet, progressing to sensory and motor involvement.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: He first noticed neuropathic symptoms 8 years post-transplant (at age 74), alongside some weight loss.

functional_data.summary: Presence of ATTR amyloid deposits confirmed by fat aspirate.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is the most common form associated with familial amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The donor of the liver had the most common form of the TTR mutation (Val30Met).
The presence of proven ATTR amyloid deposition elsewhere in the recipient is consistent with the most likely explanation of the presentation—as ATTR amyloid neuropathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information regarding the TTR variant.
